page.title: 02Hay and Silage
page.content: Farmers make hay and silage for food to keep the animals through the winter when there is no grass. To start hay or silage you fence off a field to stop the animals from getting in.You spread fertilizer on the grass to make the grass grow more quickly.It has to rain for the fertilizer to work. Then you have to wait till about June July and August.{ HAY. }First you cut the grass . You wait for it to dry about a week.During the week you have to turn it or else it goes bad. Then you have to bale it and store it. Some farmers make hay into big bales thay need a tractor to pick them up. {SILAGE. }For silage you have to mow it.Then after mowing it you wilt it(another name for drying just a bit) for collecting you can get it loose then clamp it or put it in big bales or bags.
